item.description:
To learn more about this study group, please click on the "Pages" tab above and scroll forward to the Table of Contents.  Each page in the Table of Contents contains links with fascinating details!

This time we will return to  our study of the Monad. We will start with disk 4 of a Keylontic Science workshop conducted in Morocco, at the point where Ashayana Deane explains the Monadic Transmissions and how the Monad relates to the Core of Creation. The product description for this workshop appears on the link below.

http://www.azuritepress.com/products_us/eaw.php

Scroll down to the last half of the final paragraph, where an explanation of the Monad is given.

If there is time, we will then continue this topic by viewing and discussing a KS Module by Terry Schile called "Introduction to the Monad".

As stated in the accompanying handbook,

"The Monad is an aspect of our multi-dimensional self that holds direct connection to Source.... 

 

"It is the "spark of the living flame"....

"We can think of the Modad as the light generator, the energy that comes through the template and brings it to life, and the seed atom as the core template that energy is beamed through.  They are both formed of the same intention, and are just two aspects of that intention that are necessary to create a projected, perceivable hologram or reality field."

 

This product can be purchased via the following link: http://www.azuritepress.com/products_us/ntm.php

____________________________

This Meetup adjourns at 9:00 PM. Please bring your own refreshments. Do not park in 2nd driveway which has the "ULCS Clinic" sign at the end. Come up the first driveway (with Meetup Sign). This is across the street from mailbox #298. Enter through the front door, which has another Meetup sign. No need to knock. Just go on downstairs.

If necessary, this topic be continued the next time.
item.how_to_find_us: Go up first driveway and enter through front door. Go on downstairs and have a seat in waiting room or classroom.
item.name: More on the Monad and the Monadic Transmissions
